results.firPara: As Monaco prepare to take on Tottenham Hotspur at Wembley on Wednesday, they have signalled their intention to lobby against the imminent revamp of the Champions League, which the club views as a prototype of a Super League in which France is the big loser.
results.secPara: Monacos vice-president, Vadim Vasilyev, told the Guardian that while he agrees that the Champions League needs to be reformed because the group stages are often boring, he is unhappy with the way the changes were devised and with a perceived failure to ensure fair representation for Ligue 1 clubs.
results.webTitle: Monaco’s Vadim Vasilyev: Champions League gap between Italy and France cannot be tolerated

results.firPara: David Luiz is poised to make his second debut for Chelsea in the game against Liverpool on Friday after John Terry was ruled out for up to 10 days with strained ligaments in his ankle.
results.secPara: Terry sustained the injury in stoppage time at the end of the 2-2 draw at Swansea City on Sunday and departed the Liberty Stadium on crutches. The 35-year-old underwent a scan on Tuesday once the swelling in the foot had subsided sufficiently, with the tests revealing the damage. He will also miss the EFL Trophy tie with Leicester City next Tuesday, and potentially the visit to Arsenal on 24 September.
results.webTitle: David Luiz to make Chelsea return against Liverpool as Terry ruled out

results.firPara: We spoke to 32 fans and only four of them – the Atlético Madrid, Barcelona, Manchester City and Monaco supporters – predicted that their club will win it
results.secPara: How far will you go? Quarter-finals
results.webTitle: Champions League: fans from all 32 clubs share their hopes and expectations

results.firPara: A five-year-old Sunderland fans fight against cancer has been boosted after Everton donated £200,000 to his cause, following Monday nights victory over Sunderland.
results.secPara: Bradley Lowerys familys hope of raising £700,000 to fund potentially life-saving treatment in the US took a step closer to being realised, after fans from across the league followed the clubs lead and pledged donations. By mid morning on Tuesday donations on the funds JustGiving page had reached more than £513,000 with one Evertonian writing Good luck little man. Looking forward to seeing you at Goodison Park.
results.webTitle: Everton donate £200,000 to aid five-year-old Sunderland fan's cancer battle

results.firPara: Mistakes by the Manchester City and Torino goalkeepers at new clubs are to be expected until they can familiarise themselves with new surroundings
results.secPara: Goalkeeping is the one area where familiarity breeds anything but contempt. It is fundamental in bringing stability, consistency and confidence to a goalkeepers – and indeed his teams – game.
results.webTitle: Claudio Bravo, Joe Hart and why keepers need familiarity to be consistent | David Preece

results.firPara: The head of the Cypriot players union has accused the Cyprus Football Association of intimidation tactics aimed at silencing those who dare to speak out about match-fixing in professional leagues.
results.secPara: Spyros Neofitides, who faces a minimum €5,000 fine following the Guardians expose of rigged games and illegal betting on the island and who has been referred to a disciplinary committee by the CFA in a case due to be heard on Wednesday, said the decision was a reflection of the extraordinary panic the article had unleashed.
results.webTitle: Cyprus match-fixing whistleblower faces €5,000 fine after Guardian exposé

results.firPara: In MLS, Canadian players are classed as international if they play for American clubs, which means theres nowhere for Canadian players to go
